newsitem.title: USA: DEP Corp gets lender approval on reorg.
newsitem.headline: DEP Corp gets lender approval on reorg.

text.p: DEP Corp said Thursday it has reached an agreement with its lender group and unsecured creditors on an amended plan of reorganization.
DEP said it hopes to emerge from Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection by the end of October.
--A $62 million six-year loan at an interest rate of two percentage points over Prime to be arranged by Foothill Capital Corp.

--Lenders will receive $150,000 in cash in satisfaction of certain post-petition interest claims and 542,488 shares of DEP common stock plus warrants to buy another 330,050 shares. The company has 6,251,140 common shares outstanding.
-- DEP will reclassify all of its existing common stock and new stock as one class of voting stock so all common shares have identical voting rights.
--DEP will assume up to $1.1 million in post-petition professional fees and expenses incurred by the lenders, less payments made during the case.
-- Unsecured creditors will be paid, with five percent interest, over 18 months.
